organic_results.title: School superintendents' antilabor bias in screening researchers' access to classrooms
organic_results.snippet: A field-experimental probe was designed to examine the differential acceptability to school superintendents of prounion, antiunion, and neutral researchers' requests to survey high school students in their classrooms. Two contrasting hypotheses were tested:(1) administrators are opposed to advocates, whether pro or con, in the labor relations domain or (2) administrators are opposed to prounion advocates. The survey instrument was sent, along with one of three cover letters (prounion, neutral, or antiunion), to each of 60 …

publication_info.summary: D Bramel, D McKnight - Sociology of education, 1990 - JSTOR
